intro: Cryptantha microstachys, commonly known as the small-stalked cryptantha, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant produces small, pea-like flowers that are typically pale blue to purple in color. Its seed pods are slender and contain several small, kidney-shaped seeds. Cryptantha microstachys is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid environments.
